If the temperature on the ground is \displaystyle{47}^{\circ}, what will it be at 4900 feet above ground level?
Answers should be rounded to the units place.

solution.p: The model for this situation is \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={47}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{A}.
Because we want to estimate the temperature at 4900 ft AGL, we calculate \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={47}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{4900}={29.85}\approx{30}
